definition: to comment/a point by point commentary
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The influence of he to posterity is clear.
sentences.chinese: 金聖嘆的評點對後人的影響也是顯而易見的。

sentences.english: The document theory in Dexiu-Zhen's annotation deserves to research deeply.
sentences.chinese: 真氏評點中的公文理論值得我們深入探討。

sentences.english: Chapter four is about the specific critique to Zhouwengui and the influence on the later generation.
sentences.chinese: 第四章《周文歸》的文章評點及對後世的影響。

sentences.english: Lizhi is a literature critic of the Chinese classical literature.
sentences.chinese: 李贄是中國古典文學的評點家。

sentences.english: The opening significance of Liu's novel annotations can not be overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 劉氏小說評點在修辭學史上的開創意義不容忽視。

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
(old) to instruct the young/to teach a child to read and write/as easy as ABC
to be confused/to be at a loss/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
